intro: Hieracium espoecilostictum, commonly known as the speckled hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by ray florets. It is often found in open habitats and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
